messages.body:
An Eliza Dane adventure!

When a scam email from a purported church offered a sizeable loan... who else would take up the offer but staunch Odin-worshipper Eliza Dane?

The Scammers.

, "THE PUBLISHER OF THE CHURCH OF CHRIST IN ENGLAND"
, of the CHURCH OF CHRIST IN ENGLAND
 of LLOYDS TSB BANK (BATLEY BRANCH); rather innumerate for a guy who's supposed to be a bank official
Elizabeth Roy, Paul Smith's Western Union identity

The Baiter
, a Sydney-based photomodel and Odin-worshipper with a very short temper and a really foul mouth. 
AJ, Eliza's photographer boyfriend
Odin, Freyja, and Frigga, deities of the Norse Pantheon, often invoked by Eliza
Leila Anne Ferguson, most likely another maga that the Lad got mixed up with Eliza


Western Union  has a role to play - like we're surprised by that. 

And since this is an Eliza Dane bait - expect profanity - lots of it.

And here's the come-on email, with all formatting unchanged.
messages.raw:
An Eliza Dane adventure!

When a scam email from a purported church offered a sizeable loan... who else would take up the offer but staunch Odin-worshipper Eliza Dane?

The Scammers.
[Names in boldface are inactive characters]
Rev. Richard Collins, "THE PUBLISHER OF THE CHURCH OF CHRIST IN ENGLAND"
Bishop Manuel, of the CHURCH OF CHRIST IN ENGLAND
Paul Smith of LLOYDS TSB BANK (BATLEY BRANCH); rather innumerate for a guy who's supposed to be a bank official
Elizabeth Roy, Paul Smith's Western Union identity

The Baiter
Eliza Dane, a Sydney-based photomodel and Odin-worshipper with a very short temper and a really foul mouth. [She bears an uncanny resemblance to Sophie Monk.]
AJ, Eliza's photographer boyfriend
Odin, Freyja, and Frigga, deities of the Norse Pantheon, often invoked by Eliza
Leila Anne Ferguson, most likely another maga that the Lad got mixed up with Eliza

Western Union has a role to play - like we're surprised by that.

And since this is an Eliza Dane bait - expect profanity - lots of it.

And here's the come-on email, with all formatting unchanged.

messages.body:
Church Of Christ In England 
St Johns Lane Bedminster
Bristol, England
BS3 5AY England, UK
DEAR SIR/MA,
I'M REV. RICHARD COLLINS THE PUBLISHER OF THE CHURCH OF CHRIST IN
ENGLAND.
WE WANT YOU TO KNOW THAT WE HAVE THE  CALLING FROM THE LORD TO HELP THOSE WHO ARE IN NEED AND IN FINANCIAL PROBLEM,BY GIVEN OUT LOAN TO ANY,INDIVIDUAL,COMPANYS AND SOCIETY THAT NEED MONEY TO DO BUSINESS. THE AMOUNT OF THE LOAN HAS BEEN SIGNED AND APPROVED BY THE CHURCH COMMITTEE THE SUM OF ?100,000.00 WHICH YOU HAVE THE PRIVILEGE TO LOAN ?50,000.00 TO ?1,000.00.YOU ARE TO RETURN THE LOAN WHICH IS GRANTED TO YOU IN 4 YEARS AGREEMENT.
IF YOU ARE INTERESTED KINDLY CONTACT  BISHOP MANUEL WITH THE  INFORMATION BELOW.
NAME  : BISHOP MANUEL
Email : bishop_manuel07@yahoo.co.uk mailto:< href="javascript:open_compose_win ('to=bishop_manuel07@yahoo.co.uk')">bishop_manuel07@yahoo.co.uk> 
FAX NO: +448709742091

[This is new to me. Eliza - please answer this Mugu.]

messages.body:
Dear Reverend Collins,
I'm surprised to receive this as while my boyfriend and I have issues with funding his studio project, we discussed it with nobody - as far as I know! 
Please tell me more about this program.
Regards,
Eliza Dane
messages.raw:
Eliza Dane
Dear Reverend Collins,
I'm surprised to receive this as while my boyfriend and I have issues with funding his studio project, we discussed it with nobody - as far as I know!
Please tell me more about this program.
Regards,
Eliza Dane

[New Lad, lots of questions - on the face of it, reasonable - but beneath all the padding is the old demand for ID.
One question - since when has a simple list of questions ever been called a "form" outside the Muguverse? ]

messages.body:
CHURCH OF CHRIST IN ENGLAND
St Johns Lane Bedminster
Bristol, EnglandBS3 5AY
Telephone Number:+447-024-029-977
Fax No:+44870 479 4278
Gooday to you ,
I am in receipt of your mail. 
Your inquiry have been  noticed,you are required to follow up with the terms and conditions before you can get loan from our church with no interest as long as you are ready and you will pay in good faith and at the stipulated time.
*The minimum loan we lend is $10,000.00
* You will have to pay back in 4 years or less.(not more than)
* Re payment of loan starts 1 years after loan is transfered.(Loan Approved).
To start your loan  ,you have to fill the form and send back.
1) First Name:
2) Middle Name:
3) LAST NAME:
4)  Gender:
5) Age:
6) Marrital Status:
7) Religion:
8) Occupation:
9) NATIONALITY:
10) Zip Code:
11) Address:
12)  Mobile phone No
13) House Phone No:
14)  Fax No: 
15) Loan Amount Needed: 
16)  Use of loan:
NOTE: You are to attach either your driving licence or passport for identification.
May The Peace Of Thy Lord By With You And Your Family.
Yours Faithfully, 
Bishop Manuel.

messages.body:
Bishop Manuel,
Thanks for your time. My answers follow. I have some issues that I'll address there.
1) First Name: Elizabeth
2) Middle Name: Danielle
3) LAST NAME: Dane
4)  Gender: Female
5) Age: 23
6) Marrital Status: Single (I'm sure that this is irrelevant - marital status shouldn't be an issue)
7) Religion: Odinist
8) Occupation: Photomodel
9) NATIONALITY: Australian
10) Zip Code: What's this?
11) Address: 35 Westmoreland Grove, Glebe, Sydney, Australia
12)  Mobile phone No: None at present 
13) House Phone No: (03) 9347-8666
14)  Fax No: N/A
15) Loan Amount Needed: $25,000 - $40,000 
16)  Use of loan: Establishing a photographic studio
I don't have a driving licence and DFAT rules prevent me from making copies of my passport.
Regards,
Eliza Dane

messages.body:
CHURCH OF CHRIST IN ENGLAND 
St Johns Lane Bedminster 
Bristol, EnglandBS3 5AY 
Telephone Number:+447-024-029-977 
Fax No:+44870 479 4278 
Dear Leila  Anne Fergueson, 
Thanks for your swift response.We want to use this medium to inform and congratulate you that your loan has been approved and granted,we have insured the loan with Nicon insurance company for security reason and also deposit the loan with LLOYDS TSB BANK here in UNITED KINGDOM.The church has paid for the insurance charges. We have also already forwarded your details to the bank to make a possible transfer of your loan to you.The loan approved by the church commitee has been deposited to the assigned Lloyds TSB Bank,you will be responsible for the cost of transfer,which you will find below the contact details of the bank. You are to contact the bank immediately for fast response and as soon as they get back to you, do keep me updated so that i could give you advice on all necessary steps that you are to take should anything else arise. 
BANK NAME: LLOYDS TSB BANK (BATLEY BRANCH) 
ADDRESS: 75 Commercial Street, Batley West Yorks, WF 17 5EQ, London, United Kingdom. 
CONTACT PERSON: 
EMAIL: tsbservice_bank@yahoo.co.uk 
TEL:                          (+44) 701 702 6776 
FAX:                          (+44) 871 715 9650 
Note: That you are to keep me updated once the loan has been transfered to you and remember
to pay back in good faith as you have promised and all shall be well (Amen). 
Have A Wonderful Day and Remain Blessed 
Bishop Manuel.

messages.body:
Bishop Manuel,
Why did you insure the loan? 
I don't understand why that was done. Please explain.
Eliza Dane
messages.raw:
Eliza Dane
Bishop Manuel,
Why did you insure the loan?
I don't understand why that was done. Please explain.
Eliza Dane

messages.body:
Hello Eliza Dane,
Top of the day to you, with regards to your mail sent to us, asking why the Loan was insured, the Loan was insured only for security reasons. That is to say, no amount can be deducted from your Loan amount.
Have A Wonderful Day and Remain Blessed 
Regards 
Bishop Manuel
messages.raw:
Bishop Manuel
Hello Eliza Dane,
Top of the day to you, with regards to your mail sent to us, asking why the Loan was insured, the Loan was insured only for security reasons. That is to say, no amount can be deducted from your Loan amount.
Have A Wonderful Day and Remain Blessed
Regards
Bishop Manuel

["Top of the day to you" - I haven't seen that for a while!]

messages.body:
Bishop Manuel,
You didn't answer my question.
I'd have thought that the question of security, insurance, or whatever, would be the bank's, not yours. I'll ask them about it.
That last bit has me puzzled as I don't see what it has to do with anything.
Eliza Dane

Eliza Dane

messages.body:
LLOYDS TSB BANK (BATLEY BRANCH)
75 Commercial Street, Batley, West Yorks, WF 17 5EQ, London, United Kingdom.
Phone:  +44-702-403 8064
Attention:Client, 
This is to inform you that you that we have some amount money been deposited in our bank by UK NATIONAL LOTTERY ORGANISATION  which was won by you,your funds has been verified and has been forwarded to our bank for the transfer of your funds. 
Lloyds Tsb Bank has been assigned to effect the safe transfer of your funds into your bank account in your country, which you are to provide your bank account information for transfer. 
The options stated below are the methods of transfer employed in this regards to  which entails the transfer of your funds into your bank account.  
You are required to choose an option that best suits your taste and which you will be able to afford.
The options, together with their associated conditions are stated below:
12 Hours Transfer.
Wire.....................................$750.00
Vat (5%)................................$300.00
TOTAL...................................$1050.00
24 Hours Transfer.
Wire.....................................$700.00
Vat (5%)................................$250.00
TOTAL...................................$950.00
48 Hours Transfer.
Wire.......................................$650.00 
Vat (5%)..................................$200.00
TOTAL.....................................$850.00
72 Hours Transfer.
Wire.........................................$550.00 
Vat (5%)...................................$150.00
TOTAL.....................................$750.00
NOTE: YOUR FUNDS HAS BEEN INSURED AND COVERED WITH INSURANCE POLICY WHICH MAKES IT IMPOSSIBLE FOR ANY ONE OF US TO DEDUCT  ANY AMOUNT FROM IT UNTIL IT HAS BEEN FULLY TRANSFERED INTO YOUR BANK ACCOUNT IN YOUR COUNTRY.
YOU ARE REQUIRED TO PROVIDE THE FOLLOWING INFORMATIONS:
(1.)Your chosen option above bank transfer cost. (C.O.T).
(2.)Your bank details which is stated below..
1  Bank Name :
2. Bank Address :
3. Account Beneficiary :
4. Account Number :
5. Swift Code :
6. Rounting Number :
After you have been after to make the payment for the cost of transfer, your funds shall be immediately transfered into your bank account.
Further instructions will be given to you on how to send the payment.
Regards 
Mr Paul Smith.

Paul Smith

Mr Smith.

Mr Smith.

Eliza Dane

Mr Smith,

Get back to me with the right numbers and I'll choose.
Eliza Dane

Mr Paul Smith.

Excuse me - who is the customer here? You do what I say! So send me that invoice pronto!
Eliza Dane

messages.body:
ATTN:Eliza Dane, 
I am more surprise at you attitude to have requested for an invoice.If i might ask you "Did you purchase any item?".You applied for a loan and you have been given the cost of transfer to transfer funds into your local bank account and all you do is keep on asking for an invoice using fowl languages and been rude on the mail.
This is how you fall victim to fraudsters.They will provide you with an invoice for no just cause you send them funds and get nothing in return.You were shown you Loan that was deposited with us and all measure to transfer funds to you is already in place.
I will advice you to effect payment so that we can proceed in transferring funds into your account failure to do that will mean a decline to your application.Your urgent response is needed as soon as possible.Have a nice day.
Regards 
Mr Paul Smith.
messages.raw:
Paul Smith

[It's not only the weirdest and lamest excuse for not providing an invoice, but with a comical spelling howler to boot.]

ATTN:Eliza Dane,
I am more surprise at you attitude to have requested for an invoice.If i might ask you "Did you purchase any item?".You applied for a loan and you have been given the cost of transfer to transfer funds into your local bank account and all you do is keep on asking for an invoice using fowl languages and been rude on the mail.
This is how you fall victim to fraudsters.They will provide you with an invoice for no just cause you send them funds and get nothing in return.You were shown you Loan that was deposited with us and all measure to transfer funds to you is already in place.
I will advice you to effect payment so that we can proceed in transferring funds into your account failure to do that will mean a decline to your application.Your urgent response is needed as soon as possible.Have a nice day.
Regards
Mr Paul Smith.

messages.body:
Mr Smith,
With respect - forget it, you don't deserve it!
Since I don't have an account with your bank, I can't pay your fees the normal way. I'd assumed that you'd set up the details for a transfer from my bank to yours. Instead, you demand payment by Western Union - which is like no fucking bank I ever heard of. I asked for an invoice for that very reason - because you're making no sense.
"This is how you fall victim to fraudsters" - what the fuck has this got to do with anything? Do fraudsters usually go around offering bank loans? Are bank officers usually con artists? 
I don't know what you've been drinking (or sniffing or smoking) but it ain't nice to see what it does to you.
If you were the genuine article - and/or completely sober - you'd stump up an invoice without a second thought and I'd be honey-sweet. Instead you turn up your nose and I've lost my temper.
Just send me the fucking invoice and let's get this done and dusted.
Eliza Dane

Eliza Dane

"This is how you fall victim to fraudsters" - what the fuck has this got to do with anything? Do fraudsters usually go around offering bank loans? Are bank officers usually con artists? I don't know what you've been drinking (or sniffing or smoking) but it ain't nice to see what it does to you.
If you were the genuine article - and/or completely sober - you'd stump up an invoice without a second thought and I'd be honey-sweet. Instead you turn up your nose and I've lost my temper.
Just send me the fucking invoice and let's get this done and dusted.
Eliza Dane
